title: Dr. Seuss Bad, Critical Race Theory … Good? | Guest: Shane Jett | 3/2/21
description:
Multiple states are starting the process to ban critical race theory — is your state one of the brave ones? After initially defending CPAC, Hyatt Hotels has now condemned it for its “offensive” stage design. The University of Texas’ fight song, “The Eyes of Texas," has been accused of having “racist undertones.” After warning his students that free speech is under attack, a high school principal was fired. Six Dr. Seuss books will no longer be printed for allegedly being racist. Oklahoma State Sen. Shane Jett explains his new bill to ban critical race theory. Glenn gives an update on how he was canceled from an art gallery. Glenn discusses how ESG scores will be used in the future to qualify people depending on how woke they are.
